info.name: SPO REST API (ACS-based app-only)
info.description:
# ACS-based app-only

### 1) Go to: [https://contoso.sharepoint.com/sites/site/_layouts/15/appregnew.aspx](https://contoso.sharepoint.com/sites/site/_layouts/15/appregnew.aspx)

- Generate `Client Id` and `Client Secret`, save them
- Add title (e.g. `Postman app`)
- App Domain: `www.localhost.com`
- Redirect URI: `https://www.localhost.com`
    

([Granting access using SharePoint App-Only | Microsoft Learn](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/sharepoint/dev/solution-guidance/security-apponly-azureacs))

### 2) Go to: [https://contoso.sharepoint.com/sites/site/_layouts/15/appinv.aspx](https://contoso.sharepoint.com/sites/site/_layouts/15/appinv.aspx)

In App Id set `Client Id` form step 1).  
Fill the Permission Request XML:

``` xml
<AppPermissionRequests AllowAppOnlyPolicy="true">
<AppPermissionRequest Scope="http://sharepoint/content/sitecollection/web" Right="FullControl" />
</AppPermissionRequests>

```

([Add-in permissions in SharePoint | Microsoft Learn](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/sharepoint/dev/sp-add-ins/add-in-permissions-in-sharepoint?redirectedfrom=MSDN#types-of-add-in-permissions-and-permission-scopes))

### 3) Important!

> Azure Access Control (ACS), a service of Azure Active Directory (Azure AD), has been retired on November 7, 2018 
  

Connect to SPO by **PnP PowerShell** and run [cmdlet](https://pnp.github.io/powershell/cmdlets/Set-PnPTenant.html#-disablecustomappauthentication):

``` PowerShell
Set-PnPTenant -DisableCustomAppAuthentication $false

```
